website_summaries.verdict: Hand-bottled conditioner made by 50-year-old family business. Rejuvenates old-looking leather, softens newer leather goods, too.
pros: Use on gloves, boots, purses, leather furniture, and saddles to restore luster to leather goods
cons: May leave tacky residue after applying
Could deeply darken lighter leather products

customer_reviews.title: It is literally like honey, and sticks to everything
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 cars that all have leather.. man what a mess. It is literally like honey, and sticks to everything. The shine never goes away, and it altered the original appearance. May be good for small items like shoes and wallets and purses, but my clothes stick to my seats now and you can see all the dark where moisture soaked into my clothes from sitting down. This is even after wiping it off and trying to remove it!
customer_reviews.author: C Hart

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I did everything as per instructions, but this conditioner ruined an expensive Gurkha leather key case. It significantly darkened the tan color which has not come back to original color despite leaving it on for some time. It should clearly state that it is not intended for light color leather surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Anomaly

customer_reviews.title: sticky, disgusting, hard to apply evenly, leaves dark spots
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate this product. It's sticky and disgusting and hard to spread out thinly and evenly, so that it leaves random dark spots that take a long time to be absorbed. It's very difficult to use. I use Lexol and Apple leather conditioner all the time and they work fine, but I wanted something a bit more heavy duty. I will move on to trying Blackrock next.
customer_reviews.author: BSC

customer_reviews.title: If you purchase, test a small area before using!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to condition a couch, chair and ottoman. I am very glad I did a small test, as suggested on the package. It darkened the leather significantly more than I expected. Why I rate this so low is because it made the leather sticky. I checked the next few days to see if it needed time to be absorbed. It was still unacceptable. It would have been miserable if I had used this product on the seating area of the furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Raabe

customer_reviews.title: Works great, recommended
customer_reviews.text: This leather conditioner worked great for my well-loved leather jacket. Used in conjunction with, I was able to clean and condition the entire jacket in about 2 hours total. The conditioner comes as a gel. It does darken the leather a bit, but after it's been applied and left to sit for 24h, the leather is much more supple. My jacket is so happy! Attached are two "after" photos.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnson

customer_reviews.title: horrible for leather car seats
customer_reviews.text: Im sure this works well for smaller items (shoes, belts, etc....) but it says this can be used for leather car seats and I just dont see how. This product is extremely thick and close to impossible to spread evenly. It does leave a good, noticeable shine, but for use on a large surface you should look elsewhere. Ive used it in my car several times (even tried heating it to thin out and help spread) but its such a pain in the ass to use this stuff on car seats. It will leave spots darker wherever you first apply it because it does not spread
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Frigo

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the bad reviews. This product is NOT a leather conditioner in any traditional sense of the word. It is like pouring honey onto your leather shoes and boots, working it in and then... no buffing in up to a shine, no conditioning of the leather. It gets absorbed and then looks JUST as dull and dry as before. And I applied it MULTIPLE times, thinking it was just being absorbed. Save yourself some aggravation and if you are looking to condition high quality leather boots and shoes- purchase the Dubarry Leather Cream. It's an amazing product and I'm kicking myself that I decided to try this Leather Honey. Big mistake.
customer_reviews.author: sladeatlanta

customer_reviews.title: Warning... mixed results
customer_reviews.text: Leather Honey is a product that can improve the condition on some shoes, yet can ruin other shoes. In all cases, I tested a small portion of a shoe, however, because some leathers are not uniform throughout the entire shoe, the test can be meaningless. The attached photos show the result after a thin application to my Cole Haan moccasins...they are now ruined Very thick, a little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: william p

customer_reviews.title: wipe on...mmmm leather.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do the job. One third of a bottle was able to do a large leather couch and a leather love seat and ottoman. You really need to keep it working or it will absorb quickly into the leather. It did darken my leather in areas that seem most stressed...seams, folds but the darkness faded away after a couple of days and all dark areas returned to the natural color, as if excesses on the surface evaporated away.. Left the leather supple, not sticky. Cleans up very easy, washes off your hands easily. No odors or other chemical issues. Bought this due to my sensitivity to chemicals. Reccomended.
customer_reviews.author: Calazon

customer_reviews.title: Saved my hand bag!
customer_reviews.text: I had a purse that got wet and discolored. It was a few years old and I had not taken care of it very well. The natural leather should be maintained regularly but I had neglected it. After applying Leather Honey Leather Conditioner The deep and rich natural leather color came out and the handbag became supple and soft again! I'm sure the added protection of this product will keep it looking like new for years!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best conditioner
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a leather handbag from fossil. This stuff is magic. It really brings life back to the leather. However before you buy please remember this is a conditioner, not a waterproofer or a sealant. This is top notch for a conditioner and will make your leather supple and beautiful. Some darkening may happen at first but will usually lighten over time. Leather is a porous surface and will darken when wet or in this case conditioned. It's a natural surface, not a dyed or painted manufactured product. Live it and love it. That's the beauty of leather. And love your leather with leather honey. I recommend working it in with the warmth of your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Foxy Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the "miracle" scratch remover/hider reviews
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our leather couch that has seen a couple of kitty hits with their back claws when they were first learning how to jump. I've used this now three times and it does a great job for the first hour or so, then it starts to dry out and every single portion of the area you are treating goes right back to the original condition. For thirty bucks, it really has no benefit on the furniture that needed it's help in a bad way. It. Did. Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: CMac -Amazon Addict!

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this, however it's too thick and resisted being ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, however it's too thick and resisted being spread well. I feel like I was forced to use a ton just to cover my sedan. I've used plenty of other products that all applied much easier and many were cheaper. I'm the end my leather looks good but I cursed this product the whole time I applied it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Caster

customer_reviews.title: Leather feels soft and nourished afterwards - but light colors darken considerably
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great on some older, dark colored shoes. But on the light colored pair in the picture the leather darkened a LOT. It lightened up ever so slightly after a few days but ended up an uneven color, much darker than before. This dramatically changed the look of this pair of shoes. That said, the leather does feel great, nice and supple, after treatment. I would recommend this for dark brown or black leather and for leather that is really old and in need of a pick-me-up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dring

customer_reviews.title: Yeah it does make it darker but also is much better than others.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many products on a bunch of old holsters. Tried that expensive French stuff.. expensive and hard to spread--no difference. This stuff is easy to spread and soaks into the leather. The results look and feel so much better. I leave it out in the sun for about an hour or so. Many say it turns darker and in some leather that is true, with others it doesn't. Those that do change look better. I find it is best to spread with a cloth as opposed to dripping on the leather. Mine came with the lid off but the seal held and did not leak. RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Conangib

customer_reviews.title: Good if you know how to use it. Improves quality of your leather
customer_reviews.text: Its a good leather conditioner. Makes the leather soft and Smooth to touch. It depends on the quality of leather and the temprature of conditioner. I microwaved 5 ml of conditioner in a tequila shot glass for 30 seconds and used an old Cotton T shirt to spread it out on the leather. Heating the conditioner makes it runny and less viscous and does help in spreading. However applying the conditioner is the hard part. It takes patience and little bit of technique to get desired results. It does alter the look of the leather immediatley. It gives it a very dark color. But that goes away in 12 hours and the leather goes back to its original color mostly.
customer_reviews.author: Azfar

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is "WOW"
customer_reviews.text: I am not going to lie. My husband said we needed to get a leather cleaner/conditioner for our downstairs furniture. We bought this furniture USED years ago from a friend! I looked on Amazon..read these reviews and ordered this one. Since we are inside and bored to death I got out and did the furniture. My husband might have been tired of me saying "OMGosh, look at this!!!" My used old furniture looks better than when we bought!! I am now going to go do a Facebook post on it as everyone needs this!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Wang

customer_reviews.title: Awful Stuff—Please Don’t be Fooled
customer_reviews.text: Please stay away from this product. It RUINED my vintage East West Instrument Co. Parrot jacket. I had that jacket since the 70’s. I am broken-hearted. This product is false advertising. Don’t get fooled by all the good reviews. If you’re using it on something that’s so dirty you’ll throw it out anyway, then maybe you’ll like it. But I really don’t get all these good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Leather Honey, incredible
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in my photos, this product made a world of difference on my leather chair. Important decisions are made in this chair, like what housework to ignore today, I can't have it dry out on me. It took me a little bit of time to do the entire chair, but it is a really large piece of furniture. I was worried it would shine and wipe off, but that is not the case. It absorbed in beautifully. 10/10 will buy again. I bought the 8oz bottle and used 1/4 since this big guy needed 2 applications.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my hermes agenda
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions and woke up to a ruined agenda. I spread the product as lightly as possible and still it managed to damage my agenda. Not only has it significantly darkened the leather, but left blotchy dark spots and streaks all over, AND it accentuates all the scratches and small lines in the leather. Terrible product to use on light colored or soft leather. Ive tried it on a black Celine cabas phantom bag, and the black leather saw less of the horrible side effects. Won’t recommend. The application is tricky, the product is sticky and what’s the use of a conditioner if its limited to using on only dark colors.
customer_reviews.author: Vita Gamer

customer_reviews.title: before vs after amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm wishing that I had taken pictures. My leather sofa is 12 years old. I've used other leather cleaners and conditions but it was looking dry and faded. I looked at recommendations and decided to try the leather honey products. My leather looks almost like new. I had been considering dying it as the dark brown had faded in several spots to almost a tan. The color has been largely restored. The leather looks and feels much more subtle. There's still some worn looking spots but I consider that character. The only downside is that the conditioner is somewhat messy to apply as it is almost the consistency of honey.
customer_reviews.author: SandraM

customer_reviews.title: Do not use for lighter leather!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchase $250 Steve Madden boots and this oil completely ruined the look. Buyers beware. The oil darkens your boots significantly and makes it looks like a wet boot never dries up. Not a good color and destroys any cool colors you have on the boot. This stuff is horrible for light leather and I am an idiot for taking their 4000 review at face value. I should have actually read what people were saying. All shine will be totally gone. I am very upset and pissed!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Sticky and Does Not Absorb
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst leather conditioner I have ever used. I bought it to use on my leather couch. It is sticky and doesn't rub in well. You feel like you are going to tear your leather. I let it dry overnight, and it just sat on top of the leather. Had to wipe it off with a soft cloth. If you are looking for a leather conditioner that absorbs into the leather and doesn't leave a sticky residue, try Autoglym Leather Care Balm. It is the same price and works far better. I used it on my car and wish I had just used it on my couch instead of wasting my money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: William Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Worst Leather Conditioning Experience of my Life
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This was a pretty big mistake to use. It's extremely difficult to apply and leaves a sticky, greasy residue. Think of actually wiping honey on your couches... Hours of effort for my two rooms. I then had $10k of furniture that looked like it had been dipped in vegetable oil. I went to wipe it off and after several hours of effort they still look and feel greasy. Not sure how this stuff got such good reviews... It was an absolute disaster for me. Thought I'd share my experience to maybe prevent something similar with other users.
customer_reviews.author: MondayMorn

customer_reviews.title: Leather looks good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this product on an old couch and new chairs. It made the couch look good again. Not new, but good. And with a few touch-ups it looks good one year later. So when we recently bought two red leather chairs I put this on to protect them. It hasn’t changed the appearance at all, but I expect it to help maintain the new look. I also put Leather Honey on leather seats in vehicles. Our 2002 truck seats were really bad. There are small cracks in the leather, which are still there~it didn’t heal the cracks, and I didn’t expect it to. It did make the edges softer and the seats look much better.
customer_reviews.author: Quilter

customer_reviews.title: Honey "REALLY"
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 2019 Ford Edge leather seats and it was all what the 1 star reviews were stick. I went back after two hours or so to wipe it down and found a couple of drops on some plastic and it liquefied and spread alot easier. I did read the part of the directions that said you could heat it up, it was at room temperature but I thought why but now I under stand. I still think it should be more user friendly without having to heat it up to use it. It did look really good after just two hours that I left it on and wiped it down.
customer_reviews.author: MEB

customer_reviews.title: Makes old furniture look like new.
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff.. I can’t comment on lighter leather changes, but I used both the cleaner and conditioner with excellent results on our 10 year old dark brown sofa and loveseat. The cleaner removed a lot of grime as I went through five rags that were stained brown. The conditioner is called honey for good reason. It goes on thick and sticky but covers a lot of surface area. I bought the 16oz size but maybe used 20%. You must wait overnight for it to get absorbed. Make sure you wipe it off and go back three/four times to remove all conditioner. Highly recommend this cleaner/conditioner.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Logemann

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. Absolutely did not darken the leather
customer_reviews.text: Found this to be a very nice product to use. I purchased a new pair of lighter soft leather shoes. Applied as directed and became a bit concerned at how much it darkened the shoe. Thought I might regret having used it. However, let it set overnight and the next morning after the honey soaked in well, the shoes looked great. They were not dark, the leather was still soft and just as I purchased them. Have not yet been out in the rain with them, but have a feeling they are going to do fine in term of resisting water. If not, I’ll follow up here.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Li

customer_reviews.title: with the quality of saddle leather and i was quite disappointed. My couch did darken for a period of ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry, I tried this leather conditioner on my Restoration Hardware leather couch which is 10 years old, with the quality of saddle leather and i was quite disappointed. My couch did darken for a period of time and then came back to its natural color. No matter how much conditioning, I saw no shine, having had better luck with other products. Although I didn’t get the results I expected I am happy to read others did.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Soft, shiny leather.
customer_reviews.text: Leather Honey is gooey, thick, and almost odorless. It has been used by me on 31 year old leather seats in one car, 6 year old seats in another and 5 year old seats in a third, and in all 3 cases it softened, made the leather more pliable, and brighter. I have used a LOT of different products over the years, and I like this better than all of the others for immediate improvement in the look and feel of the leather, and only one other I've used provides better restoration of the pliability of worn and dried leather. For leather in normal condition or not treated very often, this is the BEST
customer_reviews.author: Jerryjohn22

customer_reviews.title: other products better value
customer_reviews.text: why 3? because the product isn't comparable to others in market. Lexol is an avg product but with 16oz bottle you get 10-15 uses. Armorall same size gives to 15-20 uses. This tiny size cleaner and conditioner says a little goes a long way and i must wholeheartedly disagree. If it did then great it would be worthwhile. It didn't as it sucked into material and had to reapply. All 3 products used on same vehicle over 4 month period this is no bueno for the price you pay consider learherique for high end and armorall for everyday
customer_reviews.author: dtals auto studio

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product gave my leather boots and shoes a treatment that made the leather more soft and like new. I had hoped that it would make my golden brown boots more amber colored. It did! They are a gorgeous color. My black Fryes were delivered with splotchy grey patches that would not wash away. One treatment rendered the leather perfect and diminished small scuffs. It is not as water repellant as I would like; though the leather is older and may need more than 1 treatment. I noticed that the dry skin on my hands responded well to getting some of this product on them.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: expensive, and im not sure what it does?
customer_reviews.text: Would NOT recommend this leather conditioner is much more expensive than other options out there, e.g. mink oil. it seems like it does a similar job to mink oil. however, it didn't soften the leather of my shoes, which was my main purpose in purchasing this product. i still have not yet tested out the water resistance the conditioner provides. otherwise, it was easy to apply, though a bit sticky, and seems to not darken the leather. i think i'll have to try it out more and test it on more of my leather boots. Also, I tried the shoes with the conditioner on the rain and it does absolutely nothing. Mink oil does a better job repelling water
customer_reviews.author: Grey

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Worked well on an old expensive leather jacket.
customer_reviews.text: I have a leather jacket that has to be 15+ years old and it's a fantastic jacket and perfectly broken in. I just needed a good product to condition it and this worked great. It brought back some life to the collar and elbows abs just gave the overall jacket a good feel. The jacket was expensive - even 15 years ago when I bought it so I didn't want to dump just anything on it. This was gentle but it worked. Once I was done with the jacket I treated an old overnight bag and an old messenger bag and I used it on a few watch straps as well.
customer_reviews.author: HazeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not a magic potion
customer_reviews.text: This ruined an alligator wallet. It was applied with a cloth and lightly covered. Usually with other leather conditioners after a day or 2 the leather returned to it's original color. Not so on this 500.00 wallet. Thank goodness it was applied to a small section on the inside so not all is lost. When used on full grain leather it darkens the leather just like all the others. If you use this product, always try an inconspicuous area first. I will use it on bridles and dog leashes, but never again on anything for human use such as a jacket, travel bag, belt, purse, etc. Use at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Charkley

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this, in combination with the Leather Honey Cleaner, on my ecru leather sofa, several rust colored leather chairs, a side chair and my cream-colored car seats. I followed the directions (a little goes a long way) and it worked great - no discoloration, dried to a shine I hadn't seen since it was new, and conditioned the finish. I will definitely use again.
customer_reviews.author: mbhw

customer_reviews.title: Meant for fine, light leather? Meant for a beginner?
customer_reviews.text: This was difficult to apply and seems to have significantly and permanently ruined the color of a new light brown/almond colored jacket I bought recently. It's dark brown now and as I am not a professional in applying this stuff it left some streaks. I am not sure if this was the right product to use, next time I'll buy the $40+ spray from the manufacturer of the item to be safe. I did test this on an inconspicuous inner piece prior to use and the difference didn't seem as dramatic.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic leather conditioner
customer_reviews.text: A month or so ago I used a leather cleaner that I purchased at the grocery store. Apparently I didn't get it wiped down quickly enough because it left a film on our leather couch. I bought the Leather Honey leather cleaner & used it first, then followed up with this conditioner. Together they made my couch look as good as new! Love this product! If there's anything negative, the directions on the conditioner state to let it sit (preferable overnight). This was rather difficult since we are retired & use the couch daily, but it sure looks great!
customer_reviews.author: POwasso

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait till your leather splits
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews say this product is too sticky. This product needs to be worked into the leather vigorously. You need to keep turning your towel. When I applied it to my 17-year-old seats on my Tundra there were cracking lines but not split. It soaked into the cracks and they swelled up and it made me nervous. The next morning when I opened the door I was shocked that the cracks were closed up and the seat was supple and smooth. Like the headline says don't wait till it's too late.
customer_reviews.author: Al hellebuyck

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't last--not even for a day.
customer_reviews.text: It is, without doubt, unlike any other conditioner I have used. I purchased this item in hopes it could treat one of my Italian leather bags, one of which used to have a natural luster to it that faded through time. When I applied Leather Honey, it certainly made it, for a few hours, look brand new--shinny and supple in appearance. Of course, unfortunately, thereafter a few hours, it faded and returned to its former dull look. I only bought Leather Honey due to the good reviews I have heard, and yet, I don't know what could resurrect my particular type leather.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Featherson

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased a used set of leather furniture. Although it was in excellent condition, there were tiny scratches and imperfections from prior use and from our struggle to get in the house. After applying Leather Honey, the tiny scratches virtually disappeared, and the scuff marks were greatly reduced. It's pretty thick, so I took the advice on the bottle which suggested warming it, and that made all the difference. Leather Honey will definitely be my choice for caring for our leather furniture as well as the our vehicle seats. Love this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I like it for patent and dried-out leather
customer_reviews.text: It’s viscous and is like a slightly loose gel, kind of on the side of clear hand sanitizer goopy, I put it on dried-out hides and on my patent leather shopper. It is GREAT on patent leather but you need to let it sit overnight before using. I found that leather sucked it up right away. I also used it on a Louis Vuitton monogram bag and I liked it. It’s pretty dark but lightens up to a shade darker than it was over time. My preferred conditioner is still Apple Leather Conditioner, it seems to be the most predictable regarding results.
customer_reviews.author: Stay at Home Mom in California

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used on my 17 year old leather chairs with the cleaner and it brought back the leather to almost new condition with just one application. I am going to apply a second coat of conditioner on each chair to give it more moisturizer into the leather to hopefully bring out their full suppleness. Easy to apply but goes on like honey (thick) so the conditioner takes more time to apply then the cleaner, but did not discolor or ruin these beautiful leather chairs. HIGHLY RECOMMEND BOTH THE CLEANER AND CONDITIONER. YOU WON'T BE DISSAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty sure this permanently stains and darkens leather
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to apply, used it on black BMW leather on the back seats, it's nearly impossible to spread it about. A year later I can still see where thicker portions of it were applied. I'm pretty sure this permanently stains and darkens leather. I usually trust Amazon ratings, but this single product calls that trust into question.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Leaves Leather Soft and Protected
customer_reviews.text: After reading a bunch of reviews on products I tried this out and I've been pleased with the results. I've been using it for about a year and I use it on my dress shoes, watch bands, my mom's riding boots, and my convertible seats. It always leaves the leather soft and supple. In conjunction with the Leather Honey Leather Cleaner this product really worked wonders on my Mom's riding boots. They were brought back to life and the protection Leather Honey offers has kept them easy to clean. Caveat: I don't have much to compare it to as the only other leather conditioner I've used is some junk my parents own, probably from 1970.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G.

customer_reviews.title: Gooey stuff
customer_reviews.text: OK, after reading the reviews I decided to give it a shot over my usual Lexol. The Lexol is thin in consistency compared to leather honey. I've put two applications on my 15 year old truck's leather and frankly, don't notice any difference other than the slimy feel of the leather. Does it penetrate? I can't tell but I don't think so because it's so thick. Now that the days are getting hotter, maybe the heat will do something but at this point I think Lexol is more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Bama Swampfox

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have two Mid-Century Modern leather chairs that have been seriously abused by animal and humans alike. Their condition was really starting to get to me even though I like the chairs so much. I decided that the first step was trying to clean and condition them. So, I checked out the Amazon reviews on various cleaners and settled on the Honey products - cleaner and conditioner. Just finished the process. I can't believe it. The chairs look almost as good as new. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: booksandbelize

customer_reviews.title: I was impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with this conditioner. It's somewhat thick and adhered well to the sofa I was using it on. I did two coats on areas that were more worn than other areas because it really soaked in. I let it dry several hours with a fan to speed up the process. The sofa looks so much nicer. I used approximately 1/2 bottle on a sofa w/chase lounge, and that was with a couple "thirsty" sections. We'll see how long it holds up. I definitely have enough product left for a second application when it's needed.
customer_reviews.author: smm

customer_reviews.title: Application
customer_reviews.text: I used an ordinary rectangular kitchen sponge tp apply the conditioner. I poured some onto the narrow side of the sponge and applied it to my 1999 Mercedes SL 500 in 6 inch strokes. After I finished both front seats I parked the car under the hot sun. This insures maximum absorbing into the leather. I inspected my work after 24 hours and it needed minimal wiping down. Not sticky. This bottle will last a long time. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: I guess technically it's not entirely possible to determine if it "works" i.e. protect and condition leather unless you microscopically look at the leather and test its moisture before and at intervals after treatment. But the leather shines up nice and it seems like your doing the right thing by using a natural oily method instead of some water based garbage that evaporates before it really does anything. What I dont like is that it's very greasy and actually makes the leather a bit sticky for a good amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: It works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.text: Takes your leather up a notch. I’ve applied this twice to my leather jacket (1x per season ). Every single time I do it takes the look up a notch. The leather feels so amazingly soft and supple every time I do it. My latter “drinks” this stuff up so easily. I actually just drizzle the stuff directly onto the jacket (so none of it is wasted being absorbed into a cloth. Then I just spread it around on to my jacket. It disappears pretty quickly. Then if there’s residue I spread the excess around with my finger. Wait the hours and it is ready to wear.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Leather Honey Leather Conditioner
customer_reviews.text: The Leather Honey Leather Conditioner does exactly what it claims to do. I have a 25 year old leather couch that my dogs loved using as a bed. The leather on the cushions was showing the years of use. Most of the color was faded and the finish had been worn off. After a good cleaning with the honey leather cleaner, I used the honey leather conditioner and was impressed with how much of the original color came back without using dye. I did however put Fiebing's Acrylic Resolene over the conditioner to help keep it nice looking. For a 25 year old couch and chair they now look almost as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: t p.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for leather furniture
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have anything to compare this to, but I love the results I’ve had with this product. We have dark leather furniture that’s about two and a half years old. It’s still in great shape but it’s been scratched up by three dogs and has some dry areas from sunlight exposure. I applied the leather honey by hand, let it sit overnight and then wiped it down. With the exception of a few areas of doggy damage, the furniture looks brand new. We plan to reapply every six months. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Give your old leather some character.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Leather Conditioner because it was easy to apply. No fuss or bother. It gave new life to a tired and dried leather suitcase that had seen too many airport baggage handling tracks. It slightly darkened the existing patena of the suitcase but it definitely is more appealing now and should help in the aging of the suitcase. I am happy with my purchase, even if the cost was a bit dear. PS: You may want to clean the leather thoroughly a day or so before applying the Conditioner. jsj
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT darken the leather.
customer_reviews.text: easy to apply. The 1st pic shown is still wet...just after applying. 2nd is a day later. Per other reviews, I was hoping it would make the leather darker. It did not. The day after drying, its the same as before. Sadly. But seems to work well otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this thinking something totally different than what its intended for, I have 2year old dark leather couches that are starting to discolor and based off many reviews they say this darkens the worn area in SOME cases, i followed all directions and left over night nothing really happened i didn't see any difference other than a shiny look, so as this didn't work for me im sure its still a great product, these are before and after photos
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: New leather with little work
customer_reviews.text: My seats were kind of dull from the sun on my 01 Honda shadow spirit 1100c which the seats are close to 20 years. After applying with my fingers and letting them sit over night I used a soft cloth and buffed the seats out and wow they look like there brand new and not slippery at all . And all I used was just a tiny amount the bottle still looks full unbelievable. I wish I would have know about this product many years ago..
customer_reviews.author: Carbine Joey

customer_reviews.title: Moisturizes well
customer_reviews.text: I used it along with a thick leather conditioner and the two products really seemed to moisturize my dry leather car seats. Some people complained of a sticky residue, but it wiped off easily for me. I heated the product in hot water, applied it with my hands, and let it sit for a few hours. It was cold out, so I left the heat on in my car and the product didn't get tacky. I wiped it off and the leather seemed moisturized. The next day, I put a coat of thick leather conditioner on over it and my seats look and feel more supple.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie6692

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT HONEY!
customer_reviews.text: This item is NOT HONEY, even though the name would suggest that this is honey derived from leather. I bought this thinking this is going to be a new taste sensation since I had never had honey made from leather. While this product did give me a new taste, it was not a pleasurable experience.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Best thing EVER for leather auto interiors.
customer_reviews.text: I have seen reviews that said Leather Honey was terrible for leather interiors... I respectfully dispute those reviews and feel those folks DO NOT KNOW how to use. I conditioned 2 vehicles this summer this way: Hot summer day, seats and Leather Honey warm to hot - used nitrile gloves and put on the leather like hand lotion - quite liberally and massaged it in. Left in sun all day. Late evening when cool - used a clean microfiber towel and removed ALL excess. No gloss or grease and my wife said her 8 year old BMW seats were soft and supple. My 10+ year old Chevy trucks seats are like (better than) new.
customer_reviews.author: BoilerMAKER

customer_reviews.title: Great Leather Treatment
customer_reviews.text: Leather Honey is a really good product. A little bit goes a long ways....I bought the smallest bottle and used maybe 10% of it to put 2 coats on a ladies leather coat. The product was absorbed easily and completely and there was really nothing to buff off but I did buff it. The coat is a Chinese leather and it softened significantly after the two treatments. The coat is not sticky, has no smell, and the treatments did not make the leather shine (just looks natural). Leather Honey performed as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: DWF

customer_reviews.title: I could be the idiot.
customer_reviews.text: This product smells nice and is a good amount for the price. I have a difficult time spreading easily over the leather, and maybe I’m just not good at it. It’s a thick “gel” type substance. You’re supposed to put some on towel and apply evenly. The ‘apply evenly’ part is difficult for me to understand. Would probably be easier if it was a dilutable solution like the cleaner and it could be sprayed on and then wiped down. Overall, I’m still figuring this out. Makes the furniture smell nice and look shiny.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a used, top-name leather chair for my husband. It is the first leather piece we've owned, so I researched for several hours about how best to clean it. There are tons of opinions out there, but I decided to go with this product because of its longevity and solid reviews. I cleaned it several times because my cloth kept coming away dirty despite the fact the chair appeared to be clean. A few days later I followed with their conditioner. The products were easy to use, effective, mild on my hands, and did not have a strong odor. The chair looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Etown Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good.  I guess Leather Honey sounds better than Leather Tar.  Best buy a cannister of elbow grease with it because.... effort.
customer_reviews.text: Did up a big sectional sofa, and ate nearly a full small bottle. Seems to work great so far, but I would (and did) wear some form of protective glove. Also, expect to work as this goop is very thick, but it seems to work. Update - followed directions, went on goopy, left over night, wiped off excess, and its supple and dry to the touch. no complaints. I missed a few places that show as more shiny in certain angles of light, but that's easily enough fixed. All the dried out wrinkles are more or less filled back out to their original uniformity. Glad I caught it before the surface cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Approach with caution!
customer_reviews.text: This product hydrates and conditions leather very well. It's very viscous and gooey; honey is a perfect descriptor. All this being said it has a huge potential to darken leather significantly. If that happens there's no going back. The leather soaks this stuff in instantly, saturating it before you know what's happened. And that's that. I just used on a lair of ostrich boots and I'm totally sick to stomach with the result. And that was after doing a test on the heel with no problems. I recommend Bick 4 over this product. It's great and won't darken the leather or dull the finish. Leather Honey ... it's just too much of a risk.
customer_reviews.author: Cary S.

customer_reviews.title: It’s kinda thick, but works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews on a bunch of conditioners and settled on this. Really glad I did! I used it on my black Wilsons leather jacket... And it looks and feels great! I also used it on a pair of my wife’s Italian leather boots. They were really dry, so with the conditioner, they have a little more shine and color to them. Really like this stuff! Highly recommend. It’s kinda thick, but works like a charm. Just rub it in really well, and let your article sit overnight to soak in.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing transformation!
customer_reviews.text: I was at my wit's end with the condition of our 30 yr old leather couch made by Century. It was showing dryness on the cushions and had gotten rather dull looking. I had tried other conditioners and they simply did not change the appearance much. Leather Honey Conditoner was my last resort. I found applying it with my hand the best method, no waste into a cloth. Although it of course doesn't look new again, it has regained it's luster and the leather is soft again. I can't recommend Leather Honey enough. An 8oz bottle was more than enough and I coated my seat cushions twice.
customer_reviews.author: JLK

customer_reviews.title: This works so well...
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of leather conditioners and they have dried out my leather car interior. But this honey leather conditioner works dramatically well. The scratches on my older 2005 Infiniti sedan was as good as new. If you have to park your car outside and have leather seats, I feel like this product will definitely hydrate your leather. Good as new!
customer_reviews.author: LaineTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: great stuff
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I use it on leather couches, leather hand bags, leather coats. It brings them back to life and keeps the leather soft and supple. It always amazes me that I spread it on the item and it feels sticky and tacky at first, but I wait a couple of hours and the stickiness goes away and it is just soft. I have had my leather couches for over 20 years and they are still in great condition. I attribute that to brown polish and leather honey. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful and test before use...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my leather coat and found it darkened the leather significantly leaving the leather streaked with a dark stain. Even after several days of drying, the dark streaks remain. The product does not spread easily as it's very thick. In comparison, the leather conditioner I buy at my local shoe store for my shoes works much better. I should have used it on my coat. I sent a review direct to the supplier a few weeks ago, and have yet to hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Uhm.....WOW
customer_reviews.text: It is not often that I am completely amazed by a product. I purchased Honey Leather Conditioner because I bought a pair of alligator skin boots almost a year ago an could never get them broken in and nothing I tried would get them to loosen up. There was a huge difference almost right away when I put this conditioner on and these boots have gone from very uncomfortable to comfortable to wear in just a few hours. Just keep in mind this product will darken the leather quite a bit. We just tried it on my wife's boots and they have gone from a light brown, to a dark..yet pretty brown.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Used to lessen the appearance of scratches on our leather couch from the cat. It instantly darkened the scratched areas and it has stayed nice. No strong smells either. We weren't expecting miracles, but this repair absolutely exceeded our expectations. I noticed that a lot of people stated that it darkened their leather, however, ours didn't significantly darken. I will definitely use it again.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Premium leather conditioner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great leather conditioner - wish I'd known about it when I first bought my leather couches! My couches are full grain full aniline, and the first cleaner I used on them gave them a plasticy feel instead of that soft buttery hand. I was sick! Over the years, they have worn very well, and when I discovered leather honey I was thrilled with the results! It brought back that rich color and softness that I expected. I will never use anything else on my couches. When you buy premium leather, you use a premium conditioner. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand the 5 star ratings. it's-OK, not wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this because I lost my tin of mink oil that I usually use for my couch and chairs. It's too easy to oversaturate the leather with this stuff. Yes, it's easier to spread than the mink oil but mink oil is less expensive and, in my opinion, does a better job at evenly conditioning the leather. It requires more elbow-grease. So it's more like comparing a home-grilled burger vs a burger from the cheapest fast food place. Effort vs results
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: Very 1st use. Did a nice job.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this conditioner specifically for a new tan messanger bag. 18 x 15. Over a couple of hours while watching a rerun. Used about half to 3/4 ounce. The bag a soaked it up. Next day very little darkening. Bag feels softer than when received 2 days prior. Looks to work very well. Going to do the car seats next. Yep. I'll recommend this stuff. No harshness to my hands & doesn't smell bad. BTW I used a white 100% cotton hand cloth. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Truth be told

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: I was ready to donate our old and faded leather couch and love seat to Goodwill but my partner bought this Leather Honey and applied it several times after first cleaning. I have been amazed at the results. Our couches are back to their original color and I am not going to donate them after all. Some stains are completely gone and others are barely visible. So far it hasn't removed my partner's head stain from sweat on the recliner but it is much, much better. It costs a small fortune but has saved me thousands.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T

customer_reviews.title: Need to use elbow grease, but an amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: This was a little think to apply, but I was able to sue a small amount and buff it into my couch. The whole reason for needing this was I have expensive leather couches, two wild new cats and a grumpy husband 😉. I purchased this in the hope of diminishing the damage and keeping the peace. I did let it soak in for 24 hours. The couch looked very shiny, which made me nervous at first. I buffed the holy dicken out if it with a soft cotton rag to soak up any excess (which felt sticky). My couch now feels soft and malleable, cat scratches are much less obvious and the hubby is happy!
customer_reviews.author: Axelknows

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my leather hat. Seems to do a great job of moisturizing the leather. I've been treating my hat twice a year or so. I'm about halfway through the bottle. It soaks in pretty good. I'd probably treat my hat more frequently but I burn through the oil so fast that I don't want to break the bank stocking up on this product. All in all, seems to be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leather conditioner about 2 years ago and try to condition my leather purses and boots about every 6 months. I LOVE THIS STUFF! It works so well and keeps all my leather soft and supple. I have seen a few reviews about it darkening leather but I have not had this issue. YES, it will INITIALLY give the leather a darker hue, but when it dries my leather is always the original color. I usually apply it and let it dry for about 24 hours before wiping off any residual product and my boots/purses always look flawless. I've never had any water stains since using this conditioner! I HIGHLY recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Tori Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Renewed my old dog leash
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog leash I'm partial to, and after 30 years, it was a bit dry and cracked. I really wanted to preserve this old faithful leather leash and this was easy to apply. I did 2 coats and every time I pick it up I smile with the feel of the leather in my hand. I'm hoping it will last MANY more years. It has gotten wet, and it still feels good. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THIS ON LIGHT COLOR LEATHER!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT use this on light color leather. It looked fine on dark brown and black but when I used it on my light leather computer bag it left awful streaks. The bag is ruined. The first photo is the ruined side, the second is the untouched front of the bag. Bottom line, it's crap on light leather.
customer_reviews.author: BVT

customer_reviews.title: Love the product, love the customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have some antique leather books with flexible covers - they were so stiff and dry, I knew I had to restore them. I read online that antique books should not be restored with anything containing Neet's Foot OIL. I called Leather Honey and asked - they had to call me back twice (such nice customer appreciation) and told me that their product did not contain that and gave me a small lesson on how to apply it. The product worked wonderfully on the books - the covers are now flexible and have a bit of sheen to them. I am so appreciative of the company.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: First-time User
customer_reviews.text: Everything in the product description about applying this product has been accurate. The most difficult parts of applying it to my 2000 Sportster two-up seat were waiting for the seat to dry after cleaning it and then waiting overnight for the product to soak in. (It took less than 10min. to rub the stuff on.) After letting it sit overnight and rubbing it down with a clean cloth, the seat looks great! 😁 I'm anxious to see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Lojko

customer_reviews.title: Leather life saver - highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Natuzzi leather sofa and love seat that is over 15 years old. It has been through sun and pet wear. The sun has dried the leather and the dogs have worn it out! The leather honey saved it. The furniture literally drank this stuff. The love seat took several applications from severe sun damage. It did turn the sofa darker, but I actually like it better! It is richer looking. I used an entire bottle plus on the love seat. The stuff is like honey but soaks in. The drier the leather the faster it soaks in. No buffing needed on dry leather.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl from ivyland

customer_reviews.title: Does Darken Leather
customer_reviews.text: The waterproofing conditioner I used to use is long gone so bought this 1 to try. So glad it was on a used inexpensive purse. The purse does already have a light weight non waterproofing conditioner on it & some shoe polish on two corners at the bottom. Too small for me, so was going to make it a gift to someone else who loves small leather purses. This would take hours with a q tip to even out all the seams etc. so would not say it is so easy to apply.........
customer_reviews.author: Irish Lass

customer_reviews.title: Great Leather Conditioner
customer_reviews.text: This was used on a leather recliner and ottoman that were from the 1970's. As it was old, dry, scratched, and cracked it needed two coats of conditioner. It did a great job on the "good" and also the dry leather". On the scratched and cracked it softened the leather and made the flaws less obvious. The chair and ottoman look "healthier". Glad I used the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great product for leather care.
customer_reviews.text: Our leather couch had one cushion that was scratched majorly and one spot on the back cushion that was dry and almost cracking. After applying the leather honey liberally it made such a difference. The scratches still show a little bit but the dry crackly area is soft again. I wish we had this from the beginning but the improvement is really amazing. We will reapply as needed to keep the couch as soft and pretty as it is now.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It is very sticky, like honey. Was spreadable with a little effort. My leather sofa soaked it up and when I rubbed it down with a clean rag very little came off on the rag. The sofa looks much better but after a week decided it needed another treatment. Now it looks as good as when it was new. Have used other products before & the results are much better with this product. Also expected to use most of the bottle for my very large sofa but it took a surprisingly small amount. Am very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for new saddles.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on a new JMC saddle. The saddle was two colors. I wasn’t sure if the leather honey we change the color on the light brown. So I put the leather honey on all the dark brown smooth side, and the underneath rough side of the entire saddle. I used a half a bottle of the product, and I did get some of the oil on the light brown. At first it did change the color of the light brown, but when it dried it went back to original color. The product was very easy to apply and soaked up in the leather very well.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great job, Leather Honey!
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge, aniline-dyed leather sectional that had become dry and was in danger of cracking. This product, as well as the leather cleaner, came highly recommended. It works! Yes, it did take some elbow grease to get the job done, but the sectional looks 100 times better! I've tried many other cleaners/conditioners (including the one recommended by the leather furniture store), and none have done the job as well as this product. What I really liked was that Leather Honey didn't leave a sticky residue, which I'd experienced with the other products. Give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: jellybean55

customer_reviews.title: Leather's best friend!
customer_reviews.text: Leather Honey Leather Conditioner is really a good product. I've used it on numerous quality leather items in my home, including my comfortable leather reclining chairs, my favorite Australian Outback kangaroo hat, and my high leather work boots. You'll also find that Leather Honey helps keep your leather work gloves water resistant and pliable. I've also used their leather cleaner, which is a good idea to use before applying the conditioner. I just re-ordered so I don't run out. Try it ... bet you'll like it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Just Dave

customer_reviews.title: Unit Cost....
customer_reviews.text: Given the big 32-oz bottles are allegedly not available there apparently is more than adequate 8-ounce bottle with a higher unit price (cost / ounce) which infers the ability too generate higher profitability without passing the economies of scale on to the consumer. One may reasonable suspect that this will evolve to be the "new normal".
customer_reviews.author: A. F. Cieszkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Use it on my very expensive nubuck leather La-z-boy recliner. It is quite thick, and a little tougher to apply than some of the other lotions and other similar products, but the look and feel of the leather after application more than makes up for any of that. Do yourself a favor and opt for the larger container. I also use this on my trucks leather interior. Seems to also make inferior leather or leather like upholsteries, like auto "leather" upholstery, feel like it's higher quality than it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! I have an old and well used leather chair that gets a lot of sun. I have tried many different leather cleaners and conditioners and after using all of them except this Leather Honey they went back to the dry sun damaged leather. This stuff worked great! I a[plied it with my fingers and just smeared it around. Easy and very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It did a good job moisturizing the cardboard.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this alongside a tub of Obenaufs. Put the honey leather on my motorcycle boots, reapplied obenaufs after since the honey leather didn't really seem to do anything. Oh, they should also ship the bottle in a bag. It leaked everywhere, including on the Obenaufs and my cables in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Yes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, protects and restores leather
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a black All Saints, lamb leather jacket. Absolutely makes the leather more supple and given that the color is black I do not need to worry about darkening. Drier parts of the jacket (cuffs, waistline area, lapels) that see lots of contact/wear also look better after applying Leather Honey. I like that the product is a bit thick as it allows for a thin layer to be applied easily and then buffed out later.
customer_reviews.author: 99R1

customer_reviews.title: nice product with good results
customer_reviews.text: be prepared to have some difficulty spreading this, especially if you are using on furniture with a rough leather finish. I found at some point just using my hands to rub it in worked better than any piece if fabric, especially with the fact its a lot of area to cover. i ran out after a chair and half the couch with an 8 oz bottle so order the 16 oz if you are doing more than one piece of furniture. All that said, this product was recommended for my italian leather furniture by the seller, it restored the original color and finish, it is not sticky or smelly, i recommend this product for rejuvenating your leather.
customer_reviews.author: K.L

customer_reviews.title: The only stuff for my top-grain and full-grain leather.
customer_reviews.text: I trust this stuff exclusively on my 84 Corvette and 2003 Thunderbird. Also use on my vintage (1919) leather smoking chair and my 1997 Dale Earnhardt #3 leather jacket. Just be sure to apply in warmer temps and not too thick. Use a cloth that is not too absorbent or you will waste this very fine product, created by Mother Nature.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Doakes

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: When the instructions are followed this product works wonderfully! I used it on leather seats in my vehicle and they look great and feel very soft, not sticky at all. If you try to condition dirty leather it will be sticky. You wouldn't condition your hair without washing it first, same idea. Great product will defiantly buy again
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: First time I have used it (yesterdat)
customer_reviews.text: First time I have used it so maybe a little early for accurate assessment of the product. I have be sure to spread evenly so that no spots with more product than others. Leaves a bit of a shinny finish which I was looking for but maybe will decrease in time. A moderately thick product which puts moisture back in the leather. Really no complaints so far but need time too fully asses the results.
customer_reviews.author: JB

product_meta.title: Leather Honey Leather Conditioner, Best Leather Conditioner Since 1968. for use on Leather Apparel, Furniture, Auto Interiors, Shoes, Bags and Accessories. Non-Toxic and Made in The USA!
feature_bullets: OUR LEATHER CONDITIONER WAS INVENTED OVER 50 YEARS AGO WITH MILLIONS OF HAPPY CUSTOMERS. Same time-tested formula used today!

ONE TREATMENT LASTS SIX MONTHS OR LONGER. Deeply penetrates into the leather's pores to protect new leather and rejuvenate old leather. Softens, moisturizes and promotes flexibility leaving your leather feeling and looking beautiful! A little goes a long way; no need to reapply monthly as with other products.

THIS LEATHER CONDITIONER PROLONGS THE LIFE OF ALL TYPES OF LEATHER, including leather furniture and upholstery, automobile and motorcycle seats, boots, gloves, purses, jackets, saddles and tack. Non-toxic, non-solvent, not sticky, no odor and does not contain silicone. Water, snow and rain repellent formula. Not for use on suede or faux leather/vinyl.
UNLIMITED 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE. If you're not satisfied, return the product at any time for a full refund.
A LEATHER CONDITIONER THAT IS MADE IN THE USA by a small family business owned by the grandchildren of the original inventor. Use with Leather Honey Leather Cleaner, also available on Amazon!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars11,043 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
